cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface on an object.

div.l: In Aratta he set the Ezagin temple at her disposal
(Sum) Setting/set(?) the tiny bricks (of/scrubbed by?) potash in place (Akk) You will set (Ereš) in its place with a pure brick
Dedicating/dedicate(?) the wisdom (of?) the crafty ruler
(Sum) When he dwells in the E'engur temple (Akk) When he dwells (in) the subterranean waters(?)
When he builds the Abzu of Eridu
When he takes counsel at the Halankug shrine
(Sum) When he hews the temple of taškarin wood (Akk) When he changes(!?) the temple of taskarinnum wood
(Sum) When the abgal functionary lets loose his outer hair (Akk) When the apkallum functionary lets loose his hair behind him
(Sum) When he lives (within) the great foundation(?) of fresh cedar (Akk) When ... greatly ... pure(?) ...
When he opens the house of wisdom
(Sum) When he opens the door of wisdom (Akk) When he alters (the position?) of the door of wisdom ...
(Sum) Nisaba, the true woman, the good woman, woman who was born in the mountain/netherworld (Akk) ... which bore her
may you be the butter, in the sheepfold, may be the cream
In the treasury, you are the seal-bearer
In the palace, you are the true steward
You are the one who heaps up large and small grain piles
The ruler taking care of Nisaba
